data.title: Graphic Packaging Holding raises dividend by 10% to $0.11
data.description:
• Graphic Packaging Holding (NYSE:GPK) declares $0.11/share quarterly dividend, 10% increase from prior dividend of $0.10.
  • Forward yield 1.62%
  • Payable April 5; for shareholders of record March 15; ex-div March 14.
  • See GPK Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; initiates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Regeneron Pharmaceuticals press release (NASDAQ:REGN): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $12.07 beats by $0.88.
  • Revenue of $3.79B (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
  • Fourth quarter 2024 Dupixent® global net sales (recorded by Sanofi) increased 15% to $3.70 billion versus fourth quarter 2023; full year 2024 Dupixent global net sales increased 22% to $14.15 billion versus 2023.
  • Fourth quarter 2024 U.S. net sales for EYLEA HD® and EYLEA® increased 2% versus fourth quarter 2023 to $1.50 billion, including $305 million from EYLEA HD; full year 2024 U.S. net sales for EYLEA HD and EYLEA increased 1% versus 2023 to $5.97 billion versus 2023, including $1.20 billion from EYLEA HD.
  • Fourth quarter 2024 Libtayo® global net sales increased 50% to $367 million versus fourth quarter 2023; full year 2024 Libtayo global net sales increased 40% to $1.22 billion versus 2023.
  • Initiation of quarterly cash dividend program, $0.88 dividend declared; additional $3.0 billion share repurchase program authorized, bringing current repurchase capacity to ~$4.5 billion.

  • 2025 Financial Guidance(c)

    The Company's full year 2025 financial guidance consists of the following components:

    2025 Guidance

data.title: Graphic Packaging Holding GAAP EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.09, revenue of $2.1B misses by $60M
data.description:
• Graphic Packaging Holding press release (NYSE:GPK): GAAP EPS of $0.46 misses by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $2.1B (-6.7% Y/Y) misses by $60M.
  • The decline was driven primarily by a $103 million negative impact from the divestiture of the Augusta, GA bleached paperboard manufacturing facility and bleached paperboard price and volume declines, and a $22 million net decline in sales from packaging operations, where price declines were partially offset by volume growth.

  • The Company currently expects 2025 Net Sales, Adjusted EBITDA, and Adjusted EPS, excluding foreign exchange impact, of $8.7 billion to $8.9 billion, $1.68 billion to $1.78 billion, and $2.53 to $2.78, respectively vs $2.69 consensus. At current forward rates, the company estimates current foreign exchange headwinds to Net Sales, Adjusted EBITDA, and Adjusted EPS, of approximately $120 million, $20 million, and $0.05, respectively. Including the current foreign exchange headwind, expected 2025 Net Sales, Adjusted EBITDA, and Adjusted EPS are $8.6 billion to $8.8 billion, $1.66 billion to $1.76 billion, and $2.48 to $2.73, respectively.

  • Capital spending is currently expected to be in the range of $700 million as the Company's Waco, Texas recycled paperboard investment moves toward completion.

data.title: PepsiCo raises annual dividend by 5% to $5.69
data.description:
• PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) has announced 53rd consecutive annual dividend per share increase to $5.69, up 5% from prior annual dividend of $5.42.
  • The quarterly dividend is expected to be paid in June 2025.
  • The company expects total cash returns to shareholders of approximately $8.6 billion, comprised of dividends of $7.6 billion and share repurchases of $1.0 billion in 2025.
  • See PEP Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: PepsiCo in charts: Sequential seasonal growth seen across all segments in Q4
Lennox International downgraded at Wells Fargo on A2L pricing doubts
data.description:
Lennox International (NYSE:LII) on Monday was downgraded to Underweight from a previous investment rating of Equal weight by analysts at financial-services firm Wells Fargo. They said the maker of heating and cooling equipment faces limits on prices for A2L, a refrigerant that is considered more climate-friendly than older chemicals.

“Operational execution has been impressive, especially the rapid improvement in Building Control System margins,” Joseph O’Dea, analyst at Wells Fargo, said in a February 3 report. “Margin expansion, BCS emergency replacement share gain and inorganic growth remain attractive opportunities. However, we think elevated uncertainties add risk to 2025 that favors multiple compression.”

Wells Fargo cut its price target on Lennox (NYSE:LII) to $580 a share from $630 a share previously, based on an estimated multiple of 25 times adjusted earnings per share for 2025, a premium to an industry multiple of 23.5 times.

data.title: Axalta Coating Systems beats top-line estimates; initiates Q1 and FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Axalta Coating Systems press release (NYSE:AXTA): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.60 beats by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $1.31B (+1.6% Y/Y) in-line.
  • Record fourth quarter Adjusted EBITDA of $275 million.
  • Adjusted EBITDA margin improved 170 basis points year over year.
  • Fourth quarter 2024 cash provided by operating activities was $234 million versus $286 million in the same period last year, with free cash flow totaling $177 million compared to $254 million in the prior year period.
  • The company's net debt to trailing twelve-month Adjusted EBITDA ratio (total net leverage ratio) was 2.5x at quarter-end versus 2.9x as of December 31, 2023.

  • Financial Guidance

data.title: Ingredion reports mixed Q4 results; initiates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Ingredion press release (NYSE:INGR): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.63 beats by $0.07.
  • Revenue of $1800M (-6.3% Y/Y) misses by $60M.
  • Cash from operations was $1,436 million, up from $1,057 million in 2023, reflecting changes in working capital.
  • Reported and adjusted effective tax rates for the quarter were 36.2% and 25.2%, respectively, compared to 24.4% and 24.9% for the year-ago period.
  • Net capital expenditures were $295 million, down $19 million from the prior year.
  • In 2024, the company returned $426 million to shareholders, including $216 million of share repurchases.
  • The company expects its full-year 2025 outlook for reported and adjusted EPS to be in the range of $10.75 to $11.55 vs. $11.20 consensus.
